column4: Digital Elevation Model describing the bare surface of the earth, with a resolution between 0.1 and 1 meters, as provided by national geodata authority
Aerial Imagery as a base layer for analysis and mapping, with a resolution between 1 and 10 meter, as provided from national geodata authorities
Aerial Imagery as a base layer for analysis and mapping, with a resolution between 0.1 and 1 meter, as provided from national geodata authorities
Boundaries of country and its administrative units such as states, regions or districts, as provided from national geodata authorities
Names of capital and main cities, as provided from national geodata authorities
Boundaries of the watershed for the characterization of river basins, provided by national metoffice or other national institution in charge
Description of the river network, provided by national metoffice or other national institution in charge
Measurements of river discharge for a number of river gauges
Records of previous flood events containing information about dates, flooded places, flood severity even in descriptive form
geological characterization of the Soil, with resolution typically between 100-500 meters
characterisation of soil types, with resolution typically between 100-500 meters
water depth, duration for return periods 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500, 1000 yrs
water depth, duration and flow velocity for return periods 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500, 1000 yrs
meteorological data
hydrological data
characterisation of sea surface, resolution 1km or lower
characterisation of sea surface, provided by national nautics and navigation authority, resolution 100m or higher
Tsunami wave heights nearshore
column5: can be found in literature, such as: Thio, H. K., P. Somerville, and G. Ichinose (2007), Probabilistic analysis of strong ground motion and tsunami hazard in Southeast Asia, J. Earthquake Tsunami, 1(2), 119–137, doi:10.1142/S1793431107000080; Sørensen, M. B., M. Spada, A. Babeyko, S. Wiemer, and G. Grünthal (2012), Probabilistic tsunami hazard in the Mediterranean Sea, J. Geophys. Res., 117, B01305, doi:10.1029/2010JB008169.,10

column4: based on terrain slope
based on model incl. Digital Surface Model
map of flood protection measures, incl. design return periods, from national authorities
Wind speeds (peak velocities) for different return periods (2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500, 1000 years) with a resolution typically between 1-10 km, based on local measurements
list of past earthquake events on a national scale from national authorities
list of past earthquake events on a detailled scale from national authorities
map with active faults on a national scale from national authorities
map with active faults on a detailled scale from national authorities
curves of seismic hazard for a number of return periods
map of seismic hazard for a number of return periods
national seismic hazard model
regional seismic hazard model
site conditions map, derived from topograpy or geology)
site conditions map, derived from microzonation studies)
incl. buildings and vegetation
expected changes in hazard intensity and probability
dataset describing the land cover / land use such as residential, industrial, agricultural, with a resolution of typically 100m
national population statistics, usually available per administrative unit
local population statistics, from local offices, per adress or district, incl. age and gender
Information about economic activites, expressed as economic production output per economic sector, available from national ministry of trade and finance
Information about economic activites, expressed as economic production output and output on building or adress level, available from national ministry of trade and finance
specification of building use expressed as count per spatial unit, classified for example as residential, industrial, commercial, public building with a resolution typically between 100m and 1km
specification of building replacement value use expressed as average value per building type
specification of building height (meters, number of storeys)on a building footprint basis
specification of building  material on building footprint basis
specification of roof type on building footprint basis
agricultural production per crop type
Characterisation of the road infrastructure, classified as road types, such as major roads, highways, available from national road authority
Characterisation of the railway infrastructure, classified by railway use such as main lines, regional lines, available from national railway authority
Location of bridges for road and rail infrastructure
Location of airports, including function of the airport (national, international)
Location of harbours, including economic significance (e.g.  tons of goods shipped)
Location of educational facilities, classified by type of education such as primary school, highschool, university
Location of healt facilities such as hospitals, health centres, emergency stations
Characterisation of power networks such as electrical network, gas network, including storage and generation
information about affected exposure during previous hazard events
expected growth of population and economy
expected growth of population, economy, planned infrastructure, planned exploitations
vulnerability functions per country or region
quantitative vulnerability curves per land use type based on national land cover dataset
BOOLEAN function with a water depth threshold when critical infrastructure is assumed to be affected, per infrastructure type
quantitative vulnerability curve to describe the vulnerability of critical infrastructure, per infrastructure type
BOOLEAN function with a water depth threshold when people are assumed to be affected
quantitative vulnerability function and/or mortality curve
economic impact of hazard per economic sector, from national statistics
production/stock losses per company, provided by chamber of industry
indirect losses as a consequence of business interruption per economic sector
function of hazard intensity and damage fraction per building type (residential, industrial, …)
function of hazard intensity and damage fraction per roof type
function of hazard intensity and damage fraction per building type (high rise, low rise, single family)
function for agricultural losses per crop type
function for agricultural losses per crop type and season
existing risk assessment (monetary/non-monetary), from previous national assessments
